description: Lead a small remote team of developers constructing a set of dashboards with Ember.js that streamlined common support tasks, allowing our support team to ensure customer success without engineering resources.
Architected and built private, internal JSON API endpoints on the Rails central API.
Handled all aspects of dashboard development from design to ticket creation to test-driven development.
Built internal custom monitoring tools to alert on abnormalities in the Heroku configuration of our applications

description: Co-organizing one of the most popular monthly programming meetups in the world with 120 tickets selling out every month in less than 5 minutes.
I coordinate sponsorships, speaker outreach, run larger events in partnership with conferences (like CSSConf!)
Helped build out an infrastructure around our Code of Conduct to assist in keeping attendees safe. Doing my best to help foster an inclusive environment!
attributes.name: BrooklynJS

description: As the sole developer, I made performance enhancements to the Goodstuff.fm CMS to allow it to handle much higher traffic numbers (1.6 million downloads in June 2016).
On launch day the application received a peak of 1,000 requests per minute and maintained an average response time of 50ms during those peaks.
As the development team grew I acted as lead developer to maintain the architecture of the codebase.

attributes.title: Freelance Consultant

description: Created a fully functional application complete with S3 storage integration for mp3s and images, a protected management area, RSS feed generation, automatic posting to Twitter for new episodes and a complete test suite that runs in less than ten seconds.
Generated an iTunes compatible podcast RSS feed for each unique podcast.
attributes.name: Goodstuff FM
attributes.title: Freelance Consultant

description: Responsible for developing and helping architect a leading edge corporate sustainability and engagement platform with Ruby on Rails.
Developed and architected hundreds of features while utilizing test driven development in an agile environment.
Became known as the maintainer of the MiniTest test suite through my eternal battle to keep the test suite run time under 3 minutes.
As a side project, I designed and built a new referal feature that raised our monthly referals by over 1000%.
Converted the entire application from a separate mobile web app to a responsive app in 2 weeks.

description: Worked with multiple clients on Ruby on Rails projects with features that were designed with test-driven development.

Worked both remotely and in-house at startups and kept track of all work done with GitHub issues and Pivotal Tracker.

description: Developed and distributed unique images for specialty machines in the Harvard College Libraries.
